prompt_to_run:
You will be given a task consisting of two parts:
1. A word-learning phase where you will be shown examples of a new word and give a similarity score of the word.
2. A similarity judgement phase where you will be asked to rate the similarity of pairs of objects for a total of 50 objects.


Mr. Frog speaks a different language, and you are helping him to pick out the object he wants. You'll be given a novel word and some examples of the word.

Here are three blicks:
1. box truck
2. motorcycle
3. tractor

Now pick out the other blicks from the following list:
1. school bus
2. pumpkin
3. bear
4. cat
5. Labrador
6. carrot
7. green bell pepper
8. onion
9. bee
10. box truck
11. crane
12. car
13. yellow bell pepper
14. chiller truck
15. Dalmatian
16. basset hound
17. seal
18. eggplant
19. full-trailer truck
20. red bell pepper
21. loader


Next, for each pair of the objects below, rate the similarity of the two objects on a scale of 1 (not similar at all) to 9 (extremely similar). Try your best to base your ratings on the same aspects of the objects that were important to you in making your choices during the word-learning phase:

1. terrier and bee
2. chiller truck and school bus
3. eggplant and toucan
4. chiller truck and pumpkin
5. potato and Labrador
6. yellow bell pepper and school bus
7. green bell pepper and pig
8. bee and red bell pepper
9. potato and car
10. eggplant and garbage truck
11. motorcycle and onion
12. red bell pepper and Dalmatian
13. garbage truck and Dalmatian
14. semi-trailer truck and school bus
15. bee and Dalmatian
16. mutt and pig
17. eggplant and chiller truck
18. loader and Labrador
19. eggplant and cat
20. car and red bell pepper
21. red bell pepper and box truck
22. loader and garbage truck
23. bee and box truck
24. terrier and full-trailer truck
25. seal and pumpkin
26. full-trailer truck and toucan
27. garbage truck and onion
28. tractor and bear
29. garbage truck and full-trailer truck
30. bear and red bell pepper
31. chiller truck and car
32. eggplant and car
33. garbage truck and school bus
34. pumpkin and school bus
35. green bell pepper and cat
36. potato and carrot
37. cat and Dalmatian
38. potato and full-trailer truck
39. carrot and toucan
40. school bus and pig
41. red bell pepper and onion
42. eggplant and tractor
43. garbage truck and pig
44. green bell pepper and pumpkin
45. basset hound and Labrador
46. crane and full-trailer truck
47. pumpkin and car
48. basset hound and red bell pepper
49. mutt and box truck
50. semi-trailer truck and box truck


The output should be formatted as a JSON instance that conforms to the JSON schema below.

As an example, for the schema {"properties": {"foo": {"title": "Foo", "description": "a list of strings", "type": "array", "items": {"type": "string"}}}, "required": ["foo"]}
the object {"foo": ["bar", "baz"]} is a well-formatted instance of the schema. The object {"properties": {"foo": ["bar", "baz"]}} is not well-formatted.

Here is the output schema:
```
{"properties": {"objects_chosen": {"description": "objects that the word applied to", "items": {"type": "string"}, "title": "Objects Chosen", "type": "array"}, "choice_explanation": {"description": "explanation of objects chosen", "title": "Choice Explanation", "type": "string"}, "similarity_score": {"additionalProperties": {"type": "integer"}, "description": "similarity score for each pair of objects", "title": "Similarity Score", "type": "object"}}, "required": ["objects_chosen", "choice_explanation", "similarity_score"]}
```

Please be sure to give similarity scores to ALL 50 pairs of objects listed above.

results.choice_explanation: Based on the initial examples of 'blicks', I inferred that the term pertains to vehicles or machinery, and hence chose objects from the list that fell under this category.
